title: How to learn computer science and technology in general as a high schooler - Quora

response.answer_text: I started learning this stuff as a junior high schooler. My friend Kip Musatt was building robots, in junior high school and not assembling pre-designed kits either, his own designs, with Sinclair 1000 Z80 microprocessors. He’s worked for Intel for decades now. Another couple of friends of mine were writing assembly language for a Commodore 64. I was writing assembly for my Apple IIc, Motorola 65C02 processor. Desire. Curiosity. Creativity. Grit. Make something cool. Show it off to your friends. When I was in high school they didn’t even have any computer classes, but they had a computer room and we were there, chronically. Later I spent more time at home with my awesome computer.  Your friends play games. Pathetic. You could make games. Dig in. Learn stuff. Then you take the technical knowledge and be of service to people who will pay you well for it. Or even better figure out how to be of service to others with your knowledge and skills, without working for other people. Do me a favor though. Just don’t take your extraordinary born talents, cultivate them, and then work for the military, helping people to murder other people. That’s not being of service.
